means: 发现( find的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: She'll crucify me if she finds you still here.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果她发现你还在这儿，她会狠狠地教训我。

sentence.Network_en: He finds material at auctions, antique shops and flea markets.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在拍卖行、古玩店和跳蚤市场中寻宝。

sentence.Network_en: He finds himself faced with a whole new ball game.
sentence.Network_cn: 他发现自己面对着一个截然不同的情况。

PerfectNetExp.abs: Who travels for love finds a thousand miles not longer than one ., 在爱人眼里 , 一千里的旅程不过一里.
The researchers ' discovery finds an intriguing echo in a human disease called Morvan ' s syndrome ., 无独有偶 , 研究者的这些发现与一种人类疾病有耐人寻味的雷同 , 就是莫氏综合症.
there will be a day when she finds her own happiness . you will then be pleased to see that now she has got reciprocated love .当岁月流逝，身后的人找到属于自己的幸福，他和她互相爱慕，你该感到欣慰。
A soldier finds a magical tinderbox , which makes all his wishes come true ., 一个穷士兵无意中得到一个有魔法的火绒盒而开始变富有并且娶了公主为妻.

list.abs: 《正迁移英语集训教程》简介及示... ... （3）这位将军认为…… The general considers … （3）我发现…… I find … （3）我们能够…
介词短语_百度百科 ... make a face 做鬼脸 find fault 埋怨，挑剔 catch fire 着火.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... find oneself 发觉自己的处境 find out 查明；找到；发现 finish up 结束；完成.
英语新标准初中二年级上册单词表_百度知道 ... for example 例如; find out 找出;查明; litter n. 垃圾;杂乱.
海底总动员（Finding NEMO）至今还没有出过蓝光，所以没有出现在本合集包内，海底总动员蓝光版本，将在2012年11月底发布蓝 …

entry.def: If you find someone or something, you see them or learn where they are.

example.ex: The police also found a pistol...
example.tran: 警方还发现了一把手枪。

example.ex: They have spent ages looking at the map and can't find a trace of anywhere called Darrowby...
example.tran: 他们对着地图细看了许久也没能找到那个叫达罗比的地方的影踪。

entry.def: If you find something that you need or want, you succeed in achieving or obtaining it.

example.ex: Many people here cannot find work...
example.tran: 这里很多人都找不到工作。

example.ex: So far they have not found a way to fight the virus...
example.tran: 迄今为止，他们还没有找到一种对抗该病毒的方法。

entry.def: If something is found in a particular place or thing, it exists in that place.

example.ex: Two thousand of France's 4,200 species of flowering plants are found in the park...
example.tran: 法国的 4,200 种开花植物中有 2,000种可见于这个公园。

example.ex: Fibre is found in cereal foods, beans, fruit and vegetables.
example.tran: 谷类食品、豆类、水果和蔬菜中含有纤维素。

entry.tran: 发现…处于某种状态;遇见;碰见
entry.def: If you find someone or something in a particular situation, they are in that situation when you see them or come into contact with them.

example.ex: They found her walking alone and depressed on the beach...
example.tran: 他们碰见她独自一人神色忧郁地走在海滩上。

example.ex: She returned to her east London home to find her back door forced open...
example.tran: 她回到在伦敦东区的住所时发现后门被撬开了。

entry.tran: (不知不觉中)发现(自己在做某事)
entry.def: If you find yourself doing something, you are doing it without deciding or intending to do it.

example.ex: It's not the first time that you've found yourself in this situation...
example.tran: 你陷入这种状况已经不是第一次了。

example.ex: I found myself having more fun than I had had in years...
example.tran: 我发现自己这些年来从未像现在这样开心过。

entry.tran: (某一时刻或事件)把…置于某种情形中
entry.def: If a time or event finds you in a particular situation, you are in that situation at the time mentioned or when the event occurs.

example.ex: Daybreak found us on a cold, clammy ship...
example.tran: 天亮时我们发现自己呆在一条冰冷黏湿的船上。

example.ex: His lunch did not take long to arrive and found him poring over a notepad covered with scrawls.
example.tran: 不久午餐就送来了，当时他正埋头于一本满是潦草字迹的记事簿。

entry.def: If you find that something is the case, you become aware of it or realize that it is the case.

example.ex: The two biologists found, to their surprise, that both groups of birds survived equally well...
example.tran: 这两位生物学家惊奇地发现，两组鸟都很好地存活了下来。

example.ex: At my age I would find it hard to get another job...
example.tran: 到了我这个年纪自己就会发觉很难再找到一份工作了。

entry.def: When a court or jury decides that a person on trial is guilty or innocent, you say that the person has been found guilty or not guilty.

example.ex: She was found guilty of manslaughter and put on probation for two years...
example.tran: 她被裁定过失杀人罪名成立，缓刑两年。

example.ex: When they found us guilty, I just went blank.
example.tran: 当他们判定我们有罪时，我的脑子顿时一片空白。

entry.def: You can use find to express your reaction to someone or something.

example.ex: I find most of the young men of my own age so boring...
example.tran: 我觉得和我同龄的年轻人大多都很无聊。

example.ex: We're sure you'll find it exciting!...
example.tran: 我们保证你一定会认为这很刺激的！

entry.tran: 感受到(愉快、安慰等情感)
entry.def: If you find a feeling such as pleasure or comfort in a particular thing or activity, you experience the feeling mentioned as a result of this thing or activity.

example.ex: How could anyone find pleasure in hunting and killing this beautiful creature?...
example.tran: 怎么会有人以猎杀这种美丽的动物为乐呢？

example.ex: I was too tired and frightened to find comfort in that familiar promise.
example.tran: 我既疲惫又恐惧，就连那熟悉的承诺都无法让我感到安慰。

entry.def: If you find the time or money to do something, you succeed in making or obtaining enough time or money to do it.

example.ex: I was just finding more time to write music...
example.tran: 我刚刚找到了更多时间来作曲。

example.ex: My sister helped me find the money for a private operation.
example.tran: 姐姐帮我筹集资金开办了一家私人企业。

entry.tran: (有价值的)发现;(有用的)发现物
entry.def: If you describe someone or something that has been discovered as a find, you mean that they are valuable, interesting, good, or useful.

example.ex: Another of his lucky finds was a pair of candle-holders...
example.tran: 他的另一个幸运发现是一对烛台。

example.ex: His discovery was hailed as the botanical find of the century.
example.tran: 他的发现被誉为本世纪植物学的最重大发现。

entry.tran: 找到正确的路(去某处);成功地到达
entry.def: If you find your way somewhere, you successfully get there by choosing the right way to go.

example.ex: He was an expert at finding his way, even in strange surroundings...
example.tran: 他是认路的行家，即使在陌生的环境中也是如此。

example.ex: After a while I pulled myself to my feet and found my way to the street.
example.tran: 过了一会儿我费力地站起身来，找到了那条大街。

entry.def: If something finds its way somewhere, it comes to that place, especially by chance.

example.ex: It is one of the very few Michelangelos that have found their way out of Italy...
example.tran: 这是少数几件流传到意大利境外的米开朗琪罗作品之一。

example.ex: The most unlikely objects found their way into his design and look absolutely right where he placed them.
example.tran: 那些最不可能的东西出现于他的设计中，并且在他的安排下显得恰得其所。

entry.tran: (尤指特意通过努力)发现，找出，查明
entry.def: If you find something out, you learn something that you did not already know, especially by making a deliberate effort to do so.

example.ex: It makes you want to watch the next episode to find out what's going to happen...
example.tran: 这让人想要看下一集，弄清紧接着会发生什么事。

example.ex: I was relieved to find out that my problems were due to a genuine disorder...
example.tran: 得知我的问题确实是由于病症引起的，我松了口气。

entry.tran: 查出…的不轨行为;揭发出
entry.def: If you find someone out, you discover that they have been doing something dishonest.

example.ex: Her face was so grave, I wondered for a moment if she'd found me out.
example.tran: 她的表情如此严肃，我一时怀疑她是不是已经知道了我干的事。

auth_sentence.content: If it isn't Shaviv finds high climate sensitivity.
auth_sentence.res_content: If it isn't Shaviv finds high climate sensitivity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If it isn't Shaviv finds high climate sensitivity.

auth_sentence.content: Peter Day finds out how it struggles to survive.
auth_sentence.res_content: Peter Day finds out how it struggles to survive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Peter Day finds out how it struggles to survive.

auth_sentence.content: Peter Day finds out how they are doing it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Peter Day finds out how they are doing it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Peter Day finds out how they are doing it.

Sentence.sentence: She finds it hard to get along with Mary.
He finds many of its users untrustworthy.
Comparing 1929 with 2007-09, Christina Romer, the head of President Obama's Council of Economic Advisers, finds the initial blow to confidence far greater now than then.
